reviews.review_msg: I LOVED THIS CLASSS OMGG. the prof is super kind and understanding! also, I found the material genuinely interesting esp discussing it since i lovee philosophy. if ur like me, take this class its an awesome elective.

Weekly participation and 3 papers. Some cool insights to be gained from the weekly readings, as well. Not the easiest course but pretty straightforward. Online so it's more based on TA than Bai;. TA was helpful and available.
Best class I have ever taken, I absolutely loved the prof and would take a class with her again.

Education 230 is an amazing course. At the beginning of the course, you will be extremely confused and not used to her teaching methods. Don't worry, she wants you to be confused. The whole point of the course is for you to think deeply and reflect on your experience after each lecture. I would highly recommend taking this class, it is very unique.
EDUC 230: The most emotional and enlightening course I've ever taken. Heesoon Bai: The greatest and most influential professor I've ever known. I shall just let the experience to speak for itself!!

Don't have much to say except she's such a sweet and caring lady. No readings for the class, just show up to lecture and take notes on the key themes to be able to write about them later. Paper was short and the class average was an A.
Heesoon is truly amazing. Originally took it for B-hum, but I genuinely enjoyed the content that she offered, and the discussion the class had. Would take another course with her!

Dr. Bai is an excellent educator and truly is an amazing person (very wise, but incredibly humble!). I did not expect much from this class, but my journey in EDUC 230 was transformational. I really love the concept of living curriculum that she implemented, and definitely look  forward to taking more classes with her in the future.
While Dr. Bai is incredibly esoteric, her lectures genuinely help to improve the way you look at the education system, while offering helpful tips to better your own life.

Very interesting course. Most people will take this course as a "GPA Booster" but will actually make you re-consider your education. Very thought provoking. Definitely made me more interested in taking another EDUC course

The course is not hard as u work hard on it. We need to discuss online but I found out that was helpful for me to understand the concepts that I am learning. Just provide some opinions and feedback on our educational issues.
DE CLASS. AWESOME CLASS, TA & PROF! Just make sure you keep up with the weekly readings, assignments and do well on your papers.

DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE ONLINE!!!  Hee Soon Bai is an awesome prof. in person.  Lectures are interesting and engaging.  Course is easy and breaks are plentiful.  You do not need to read anything and all assignments are opinion based.  We were actually instructed not to study for the final because she didn't want to stress us out; it was easy.
lectures arent that bad, we get a whole bunch of breaks and her topics are intersting
Great!

I did not enjoy her class at all. She spoke too quietly and was boring as hell. The only saving grace was that she had guest lecturers come in for more than half of the lectures and there were no exams in the course.
Wonderful, considerate, lovely and sincere person :) with a passionate spirit and mind.
Boring, going-in-circles lectures, quiet voice, this should just be a distance ed class
No Comments

I had to get my course regraded after I took it with Jade. My grade went up from a B+ to an A, I can only feel that she was grading me harshly because she did not agree with my opinions on education. I made sure not to take another class with her, as getting the regrade was time-consuming. If you are left-leaning, take her course; otherwise, avoid.
very easy course. only midterm, final, and tutorial participations. no assignments or anything and the TA's are very helpful. Make sure you dont study last minute though.
The lectures are quite long and boring, but it's an easy class. I did not read the textbook at all. I judge those who received anything less than a B+ in this class.
This class is quite boring and not enjoyable to me mainly because i don't like the content in this course. After all, it is an easy course to get a moderate grade.
More philosophy than education. Was not an enjoyable class.

I'll be honest and say that lectures can be boring, and sometimes so can the textbook. However, the material is fairly interesting. If you plan on becoming a teacher, it will give you a different approach on the education system. Only two in class exams and a paper. Great guy, very nice.

Lectures can be a little dull if you aren't interested in the topic, however he explains really well and is passionate about what he does. Only had 2 papers and a final. Very easy marking. His english accent can put you to sleep - I had wonderful naps in that class.
sooo boring do not take this class!

I really enjoyed taking this course. The material is not so difficult and the lectures are very clarifying. Dr. Barrow is a very good professor and he is very patient and helpful.I strongely recommend this course to anyone in the education area.

One of the best lecturers I've ever had. His views on education cut through the emotional fog that clouds so many educational debates. He's actually willing to think his way to a judgement or two. How rare and refreshing!

Dr. Barrow was a great prof! The class was a little dull but overall the material was pretty interesting, and he does his best to explain different concepts. We got a rewrite of the first paper, second paper was a little lengthy and final was easy (if you studied). Everyone applauded for him at the end of his last lecture =)

Did intersession with him. Not too difficult as it was a midterm and a final. He has quite the subtle humor and is one of the more "nice" philosophers around. We talked about a lot of different topics and he definitely tries to input his view on them. Otherwise decent class, can get away with not really reading but writing all that he says down.
best class ... changes how you understand school and view you personal experince as a student   - Phil of Ed.

Robin's class was interesting, but since he wrote the text, essentially just repeating the readings.  The focus of the class was philosophy, and not as much education as I had expected.  It was a decent class, with fair grades.

Ridiculously easy but the lectures are painfully long and boring. It is best to play devil's advocate in tutorial but go along with whatever Robin says for your essay.  Attendance for lecture is not important but attending the tutorial is essential.  Very little work required. An easy credit if you can think philosophically and write well.

Neat guy, funny guy, nice guy with intersting lectures. But..he solidifies my idea that philosophy is really common sense. He and probably most philosophers over-complicate everything. The course could have been boiled down and focused into 4 weeks. (Philosophy= a likely career with Black-Top Taxis)
I think he takes the side of teaching subjects and not teaching students. He's too philisophical and not practical enough.

...the course seems way to complex to be a 200 level course....Yes TA's did agree.....we did a total of 9 essays....the text i have no comment on other than just as complex as he is as he did write it .... a guy i would like to have a good talk with thoug
One of the most difficult courses I have taken at SFU. Requires a lot of time and effort, readings are extremely difficult to understand and assignments are way to time consuming.

Material was extremely hard to understand. I expected this class to be easy but it wasn't. Class average was low. Discussions are marked difficult. Assignments are long and boring. Overall I would recommend a different EDUC course

Scott seems to be fully invested in this course, each week he posted in depth responses regarding course materials, and his feedback on the final essay was extremely helpful. The only thing is disliked was not getting any feedback or grades until the very end of the course. I wish there was opportunity to know where we needed improvement.
Good man.
